abstract: Iranian judiciary discloses that it had sentenced former Vice Pres Mohammad-Reza Rahimi to five years in jail after his conviction for corruption, some months ago; also fines him equivalent of $1 million.
lead_paragraph: Mohammad-Reza Rahimi, who was a first vice president under President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, is believed to have been involved in insurance fraud.
snippet: Mohammad-Reza Rahimi, who was a first vice president under President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, is believed to have been involved in insurance fraud.

headline.main: Former Iranian Official Gets Jail and $1 Million Fine in Corruption Case
